title: Information about COVID-19 | Boston Medical Center
description: Boston Medical Center is committed to helping you and your loved ones stay healthy. Our employees and providers are ready to provide you with the care and services you need, in-person or virtually.
cleaned_text: In keeping with state and federal guidelines, as well as guidelines at other area hospitals, patients are no longer required to wear a mask while at Boston Medical Center. You are welcome to continue wearing a mask if you choose. [Click here](/changes-covid-19-guidelines-may-12-2023) to learn more about changes related to the end of the federal COVID-19 public health emergency. [Vaccines](/covid-19-vaccine/frequently-asked-questions) Vaccines are the best way to protect yourself against COVID-19. BMC has answers to your most commonly asked questions. [Testing](/covid-19/frequently-asked-questions) There are many options for COVID-19 testing. Learn more about each type and how and when to get tested. [Treatment and Care](/covid-19/frequently-asked-questions) If you have COVID-19, BMC can help you get the treatment and care you need to get healthy again. [Resources](/covid-19/resources) The pandemic has been a challenging time. BMC is here to help you take care of your mental, social, and physical wellbeing.
